page.title: 13The Roseland School, Tregony
page.content:
In the evening the school is used as an adult education centre. There, people participate in many activities including badminton, art, languages and mathematics.
The pupils' exams are spread out and not all in one week as they used to be.Of course public exams are at the same time as the rest of the country. In the lunchtimes and breaks there are 28 different clubs (these are not done after school because everyone goes home by bus and nobody is inside the school after 3.30pm).The clubs include an art club,table tennis and other sporting activities,bridge club,rural science,ski club,chess club,Duke of Edinburgh awards and German conversation. Pupils come from as far as Truro and all parts of the Roseland Peninsula.
